PLA.bed_adhesion_notes: PEI, glass, blue tape. Easy adhesion, no special measures needed.
PLA.notes: Baseline prototyping material. Brittle, low thermal resistance. Not suitable for load-bearing or sun-exposed parts. Biodegradable under industrial conditions.

PLA-CF.bed_adhesion_notes: PEI. Similar to PLA but requires hardened steel nozzle.
PLA-CF.notes: Higher stiffness than standard PLA, matte finish. Fibers reduce shrinkage but increase abrasiveness. MANDATORY hardened steel nozzle. Reduced interlayer adhesion compared to pure PLA.

PETG.bed_adhesion_notes: PEI (caution: may bond too strongly on smooth PEI), glass with glue stick. Prone to stringing.
PETG.notes: Good balance between ease of printing and mechanical performance. Decent chemical and UV resistance. Prone to stringing — calibrate retraction. Good choice for non-structural outdoor use.

PETG-CF.bed_adhesion_notes: Textured PEI. Hardened steel nozzle mandatory.
PETG-CF.notes: PETG with short carbon fibers. Higher stiffness and dimensional stability than pure PETG. Matte finish. Reduced interlayer adhesion. Hardened steel nozzle mandatory.

ABS.bed_adhesion_notes: ABS juice (ABS dissolved in acetone), PEI, Kapton. Severe warping without enclosed chamber.
ABS.notes: Classic industrial material. Good mechanical and thermal resistance. REQUIRES enclosed chamber to prevent warping and delamination. Toxic fumes (styrene) — ventilate. Smoothable with acetone.

ASA.bed_adhesion_notes: PEI, glue stick. Similar to ABS but slightly better adhesion.
ASA.notes: UV-resistant version of ABS. Ideal for outdoor parts (automotive, garden, outdoor enclosures). Enclosed chamber strongly recommended. Toxic fumes — ventilate.

PC.bed_adhesion_notes: High-temp PEI, glue stick. Severe warping without chamber >50C.
PC.notes: High-performance engineering material. Excellent impact and thermal resistance. REQUIRES enclosed chamber >50C, all-metal hotend, and bed >100C. Fillet >=1mm on all internal corners. Critical drying.

PC-CF.bed_adhesion_notes: High-temp PEI. Hardened steel nozzle mandatory. Enclosed chamber >50C.
PC-CF.notes: Carbon fiber reinforced PC. Maximum stiffness and thermal resistance among FDM materials. Hardened steel nozzle mandatory. Enclosed chamber >50C. Critical drying (10h at 80C). For structural high-temperature parts.

PA6.bed_adhesion_notes: PVA glue, textured PEI. Significant warping, use wide brim (8-10mm).
PA6.notes: Classic nylon. Excellent mechanical, wear, and chemical resistance. VERY hygroscopic — print from freshly dried filament. High shrinkage (up to 1.5%) — compensate in design. Enclosed chamber recommended. Wide brim for adhesion.

PA12.bed_adhesion_notes: PVA glue, textured PEI. Less warping than PA6 but still use brim.
PA12.notes: Low moisture absorption nylon (compared to PA6). Easier to print, less shrinkage. Good chemical and wear resistance. Less rigid than PA6. Suitable for gears, bushings, snap clips.

PA-CF.bed_adhesion_notes: Textured PEI, PVA glue. Hardened steel nozzle mandatory. Enclosed chamber.
PA-CF.notes: The strongest FDM material. Carbon fibers in nylon matrix. Exceptional weight-to-strength ratio. Hardened steel nozzle mandatory. Critical drying (12h at 80C). For brackets, tooling, structural parts.

TPU_85A.bed_adhesion_notes: PEI, glass. Print SLOWLY (20-30 mm/s). Direct drive mandatory.
TPU_85A.notes: Soft elastomer (85A Shore). For gaskets, dampers, grips, flexible protective covers. Direct drive extruder MANDATORY (no bowden). Max speed 30 mm/s. Minimal or zero retraction.

TPU_95A.bed_adhesion_notes: PEI, glass. Direct drive strongly recommended. Max speed 40 mm/s.
TPU_95A.notes: Semi-rigid elastomer (95A Shore). Easier to print than 85A, compatible with some short bowden tubes. For bumpers, belts, cable glands, semi-flexible parts. Max speed 40 mm/s.

Tullomer.bed_adhesion_notes: Textured PEI, glue stick. Enclosed chamber recommended. All-metal hotend.
Tullomer.notes: Bio-based high-performance polymer by Extrudr. Alternative to PC for high-temperature applications. Excellent chemical resistance, food-safe. Fillet >=1mm on all internal corners mandatory. Check creep at 80C for sustained loads. Print orientation critical for mechanical strength.

PVA.bed_adhesion_notes: Do not use as structural material. Support material only.
PVA.notes: SUPPORT MATERIAL ONLY. Water-soluble (soak 12-24h in warm water). Compatible with PLA and PETG. EXTREMELY hygroscopic — store in sealed drybox. Print immediately after opening.

HIPS.bed_adhesion_notes: PEI, Kapton. Enclosed chamber recommended (like ABS).
HIPS.notes: D-Limonene soluble support material for ABS/ASA. Can be used as lightweight structural material but limited strength. Enclosed chamber recommended. Fumes — ventilate.
